The 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, France, will feature the exciting sport of archery, where skilled athletes from around the world will compete for gold, silver, and bronze medals. The archery events will take place at the historic Les Invalides venue from July 25 to August 4, 2024.

Venue: Les Invalides

Les Invalides, a complex of buildings in the 7th arrondissement of Paris, will serve as the stunning backdrop for the Olympic archery competitions. This iconic site, originally built as a hospital and retirement home for war veterans, boasts a rich history and architectural beauty. The archery events will be held in the expansive courtyard, providing a unique and picturesque setting for athletes and spectators alike.

Dates and Schedule

The archery competitions at the 2024 Summer Olympics will span 11 days, from July 25 to August 4, 2024. The schedule will include both individual and team events for men and women. Here's a breakdown of the key dates:

July 25-27: Men's and Women's Individual Ranking Rounds

July 28-30: Men's and Women's Individual Elimination Rounds

July 31: Men's and Women's Individual Finals

August 1-2: Men's and Women's Team Elimination Rounds

August 3: Men's and Women's Team Finals

August 4: Mixed Team Event

Events and Competitors

The 2024 Olympic archery competition will feature a total of five events:

Men's Individual

Women's Individual

Men's Team

Women's Team

Mixed Team

A total of 128 athletes, equally divided between men and women, will participate in the archery events. Each country can send a maximum of six athletes (three men and three women) to compete in the individual and team events.

The individual events will begin with a ranking round, where each archer shoots 72 arrows at a target 70 meters away. The scores from this round will determine the seeding for the subsequent elimination rounds, which follow a single-elimination format until the gold, silver, and bronze medalists are determined.

In the team events, teams of three archers compete in a head-to-head format, with each team shooting a total of 24 arrows per match. The mixed team event, introduced at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, features one male and one female archer from each country competing together.

The archery competitions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris promise to be a thrilling display of skill, precision, and mental fortitude. With the historic Les Invalides serving as the venue and a diverse array of events and talented competitors, fans can expect to witness unforgettable moments of athletic excellence. As the world's best archers gather in the City of Light, the stage is set for a captivating showcase of this timeless Olympic sport.
